Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the presence of "Christian content warnings" before "A Charlie Brown Christmas" by stating that they were aired, when in fact they were not.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to support the existence of the "Christian content warnings" before the show.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the "Christian content warnings" were added out of fear of offending or upsetting audiences, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no such warnings appeared during the airing of "A Charlie Brown Christmas" on November 30, 2015.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the claim was based on a false rumor or misinformation, as there were several false claims and controversies surrounding the Christian content of the show in 2015.
